article.Heading: India better placed than most markets for fund inflows:Lambregts
article.Summary: For global investors looking to park their funds somewhere, the return versus risk is limited almost in every market, Jan Lambregts of Rabobank says, adding that investors who are open to taking some risk could prefer India as there is some hope from the new government.
article.Body:
Jan Lambregts of Rabobank says the recent underperformance by Indian market is baffling considering the country has limited linkages with the global economy. Although he feels Tuesday's market rally is a bear market bounce-back, the Budget might have improved sentiment and some foreign fund inflows might be seen in the near term. 

For global investors looking to park their funds somewhere, the return versus risk is limited almost in every market, Lambregts says, adding that investors who are open to taking some risk could prefer India as there is some hope from the new government.

He, however, also points out that a lot still depends on how the global market performs and the picture there does not seem to be as rosy as it might appear at times.
